Bolashak Scholars PowerBI Workshop Syllabus

  • Fall 2025
  • Room TBD, Dec 3, 3:30-5pm

  • N/A Credit Hours

  • Instructor: Jill Naiman
    • Email: jnaiman@illinois.edu
    • Office: Online
    • Office Hour: by appointment
    • Preferred Contact Method: email

Welcome to the Bolashak Scholars PowerBI Workshop!

Data visualization is crucial to conveying information drawn from models, observations or investigations. This workshop will provide a brief overview of visualization “best practices” and where things can “go wrong” with data viz.
We will apply the PowerBI tool for some practical and hands-on data visualization and analysis.

Note on 11/24/2025 – More details and materials to be filled in over the next few days

Prerequisites: Highly suggested pre-installation

1. Install Excel

Prior to the workshop, please install Excel locally on your computer (if not already installed), or update to the latest version (if its been a while since you updated).

See link to lecture slides for how to install linked here.

Additionally, be sure you are signed in to your @illinois.edu account online (https://outlook.office365.com/) for accessing all links/materials.

2. Install the Google Chrome Browser

It is highly recommended that you use the Chrome Browser for our activities with PowerBI.

3. Check you can access PowerBI

Using this link to the online PowerBI version make sure you are able to access with your @illinois.edu account.

4. (OPTIONAL) Turn on your Google Access with your @illinois.edu account

This next part may or may not work, depending on how your @illinois.edu account is set up.

First, go to the linking dashboard. You will be prompted to choose your campus and likely asked to sign in.

Then click on the “Google Apps @ Illinois” button so the “ON” portion is green:

More documentation can be found here.

Modules

This workshop will be conducted in several main Modules.

Below are some links to further reading, and videos of parts of the workshop. All Reading/Materials are optional and can be revisited after the workshop!

To access the videos, be sure you’ve made a MediaSpace account using your @illinois.edu credentials.

Module Topic Readings/Materials
Module 1 Introduction to this workshop 0. Install Excel through the Illinois Webstore (do this pre-workshop!)
1. Who is your instructor anyway?
2. Fundamentals of Data Visualization by Claus O. Wilke
3. Visualization Analysis & Design, Tamara Munzner. Many concepts found on the books webpage and the associated lecture slides.
Module 2 Data Viz Basics 1. Perception in Visualization
2. The Data Viz Picker
3. Data Viz Caveats
4. Storytelling with Data: A Data Visualization Guide for Business Professionals by Knaflic (available via UIUC library).
Module 3 Getting Started with PowerBI 1. PowerBI Walkthrough 1 – Google Doc (be sure you’re using your @illinois.edu account) OR PDF version (click on “More Pages” at bottom to see more) & MediaSpace Video (be sure you have created and are signed into your MediaSpace account)
2. Microsoft’s PowerBI overview
3. Microsoft’s Getting Started with PowerBI
4. Microsoft’s PowerBI training
Module 4 More with PowerBI & PowerQuery 1. Walkthrough 2 – Google Doc & MediaSpace Video
2. Walkthrough 3 – Google Doc & MediaSpace Video
3. Microsoft’s intro to PowerQuery
Module 5 Where to go from here 1. Where to go from here resources: TBD
